title: The Last Saturday of October: The Declassified Secrets of Black Saturday
description: The Last Saturday of October is a submarine thriller that discloses recently declassified information to chronicle the little-known B-59 incident. It recreates the story of an unsung Russian hero, Soviet naval officer Vasili Arkhipov, who intervened to thwart a nuclear attack on the United States on the most dangerous day in human history. Ride the B-59 from Murmansk to the American naval blockade and experience Black Saturday from inside the hull.It transports you to the mysterious world of Soviet diesel submarines to portray the true story of an international brush with disaster during the Cold War. Four Russian submarines carrying nuclear torpedoes secretly sailed from the Arctic Circle into the Cuban Missile Crisis in October 1962. Plagued by mission uncertainty and confusing instructions on when to use their weapons, they battled fierce storms and Hurricane Ella to reach the Sargasso Sea where the subtropical heat turned their subs into hell holes. When they surfaced to relieve their suffering, they faced the largest antisubmarine force ever assembled in one ocean waiting to attack.
author: Douglas Charles Gilbert
